row.English: do you want to go home? to go back?

row.Achumawi: latˑiw wáté c̓ásti aˑyéq̓ti latˑiw wáté c̓ásti aˑtúˑm̓i hatˑáˑmílíl

row.English: go home! go back! go away!
go to the mountain and seek power
how are you? (how do you feel?)
I'm going home. I'm going back.
he/she is in love with me
it's going to be good weather.
it's raining water. (water is coming down.)
I don't want to drink water.
row.Achumawi: c̓é suwí as tisˑí w̓a tíˑci

row.English: I feel compassion for (him, her, them)
I want to go to Glass Mountain.
I want to have a vision.
I want to learn to speak Pit River.
I want to learn to speak Wintu.
row.Achumawi: eqpiˑmí u w̓á tisˑi ya w̓a tisˑí w̓a síuwí

row.English: I wish I had some acorn.
let's us two (I and you) got.
let's us two (I and you) eat.
live properly! live in the right way!
nephew or niece: man's brother's child

row.Achumawi: latˑiw wáté hatˑáˑmá aˑyéq̓ti latˑiw wáté hatˑáˑmá aˑtúˑm̓i malúsˑi tuci kuci ham̓ís saʔáncíʔ

row.English: now run up the mountain and pray!
row.Achumawi: nám̓ qá aq̓ˑo ticukʰˑé má titʰˑákya

row.Commentary: loan word from Chinook Jargon (French cochon)

row.Achumawi: latˑiw wáté hak̓ aˑyéq̓ti latˑiw wáté hak̓ aˑtúˑm̓i
latˑiw wáté ham̓ís aˑyéq̓ti latˑiw wáté ham̓ís aˑtúˑm̓i
y̓áˑlúpcící ʔúlúpciciw̓áté c̓up w̓ámˑíˑcí qá c̓ul

row.English: sun is getting low; near sunset
that's a rock (you already know it).
that's a salmon (you already know it).
that is cold (you already know it).
this is a rock (you already know it).
this is a salmon (you already know it).

row.Commentary: wash your face and be cleaṇ

row.English: we two (not you) see a grizzly bear.
we two (I and you) see a grizzly bear.
we two (I and you) will eat.
we (not you) see a brown bear.
we (including you) see a brown bear
what are you called? what's your name?
nephew or niece: woman's brother's child
nephew or niece: woman's sister's child
